dialogues.text: Here we go.  The volume control is on the side.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: That's great. William, the headphones on, surveys the scene -- the clus a full 100 yards from the action, to allow a gracious swe wide-shot.  He watches Anna.  She is with her co-star in Henry James film -- let's call him James.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: We are living in cloudcuckooland -- we'll never get this done today.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We have to.  I've got to be in New York on Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Oh, stop showing off. He studies an actress a few yards to the left.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: God, that's an enormous arse.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I'm not listening.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No, but seriously -- it's not fair -- so many tragic young teenagers with anorexia -- and that girl has an arse she could perfectly well share round with at least ten other women -- and still be beg-bottomed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I said I'm not listening -- and I think, looking at something that firm, you and your droopy little excuse for an 'arse' would be well-advised to keep quiet. Back by the desk, William is listening and laughs.  That' girl.  Anna prepares.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So I ask you when you're going to tell everyone, and you say...?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: 'Tomorrow will be soon enough.'

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: And then I... right.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Who was that rather difficult chap you were talking to on the way up?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh... no one... no one.  Just some... guy from the past.  I don't know what he's doing here.  Bit of an awkward situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut back to William -- he has heard.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Of course. He takes off the headphones and puts them gently down.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Anytime. William walks away.  The moment of hope is gone.  He coul have had a clear reminder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William is emptying Anna Scott videos into a box.

dialogues.speaker: SPIKE
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I'm going to throw out these old videos.

dialogues.speaker: SPIKE
dialogues.text: No.  You can't bin these.  They're classics.  I'm not allowing this.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Right -- let's talk about rent...

dialogues.speaker: SPIKE
dialogues.text: Let me help.  We don't want all this shit cluttering up our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next day.  William is hard at work, doing the account dark small room with files in it.  Martin pops his head i

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I have to disturb you when you're cooking the books, but there's a delivery.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Martin, can't you just deal with this yourself?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: But it's not for the shop.  It's for you.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Okay.  Tell me, would I have to pay a wet rag as much as I pay you? They head out, Martin behind him, incomprehensively rubbi his hands -- he's in a very good mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William enters -- and there stands Anna -- in a simple bl skirt and top.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yes -- I'm sorry -- I had to leave... I didn't want to disturb you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Well... how have you been?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Fine.  Everything much the same.  When they change the law Spike and I will marry immediately.  Whereas you... I've watched in wonder.  Awards, glory ...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh no.  It's all nonsense, believe me. I had no idea how much nonsense it all was -- but nonsense it all is... (she's nervous) Well, yesterday was our last day filming and so I'm just off -- but I brought you this from home, and... It's quite a big wrapped parcel, flat -- 3 foot by 4 foot leaning against a bookshelf.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I thought I'd give it to you.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Shall I...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No, don't open it yet -- I'll be embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Okay -- well, thank you.  I don't know what it's for.  But thank you anyway.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I actually had it in my apartment in New York and just thought you'd... but, when it came to it, I didn't know how to call you... having behaved so... badly, twice.  So it's been just sitting in the hotel.  But then... you came, so I figured... the thing is... the thing is ...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What's the thing? Then the door pings.  In walks the annoying customer, Mr.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Don't even think about it.  Go away immediately. Mr. Smith is taken aback and therefore completely obedien

dialogues.speaker: MR. SMITH
dialogues.text: Right.  Sorry. And he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You were saying...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yes.  The thing is... I have to go away today but I wondered, if I didn't, whether you might let me see you a bit... or, a lot maybe... see if you could... like me again. Pause as William takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: But yesterday... that actor asked you who I was... and you just dismissed me out of hand... I heard -- you had a microphone... I had headphones.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You expect me to tell the truth about my life to the most indiscreet man in England? Martin edges up.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- it's your mother on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Can you tell her I'll ring her back.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I actually tried that tack -- but she said you said that before and it's been twenty-four hours, and her foot that was purple is now a sort of blackish color...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Okay -- perfect timing as ever -- hold the fort for a second will you, Martin? Martin is left with Anna.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Can I just say, I thought 'Ghost' was a wonderful film.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Yes... I've always wondered what Patrick Swayze is like in real life.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I can't say I know Patrick all that well.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Oh dear.  He wasn't friendly during the filming?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Well, no -- I'm sure he was friendly -- to Demi Moore -- who acted with him in 'Ghost.' She's kind in here, not sarcastic.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Oh right.  Right.  Sorry.  Always been a bit of an ass. William returns a little uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Anyway... it's lovely to meet you.  I'm a great fan of yours.  And Demi's, of course. Martin leaves them.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: That's fine.  There's always a pause when the jury goes out to consider its verdict. She's awaiting an answer.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Anna.  Look -- I'm a fairly level- headed bloke.  Not often in and out of love.  But... He can't really express what he feels.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: ... can I just say 'no' to your kind request and leave it at that?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: ... Yes, that's fine.  Of course.  I... you know... of course... I'll just... be getting along then... nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: The truth is... He feels he must explain.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: ... with you, I'm in real danger.  It took like a perfect situation, apart from that foul temper of yours -- but my relatively inexperienced heart would, I fear, not recover if I was once again ... cast aside, which I would absolutely expect to be.  There are too many pictures of you everywhere, too many films.  You'd go and I'd be... well, buggered, basically.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I see. (pause) That reality is a real 'no,' isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I live in Notting Hill.  You live in Beverly Hills.  Everyone in the world knows who you are.  My mother has trouble remembering my name.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Okay.  Fine.  Fine.  Good decision. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: The fame thing isn't really real, you know.  Don't forget -- I'm also just a girl.  Standing in front of a boy. Asking him to love her. Pause.  She kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Bye. Then turns and leaves.  Leaving him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant is in the middle of being deconstructed. pictures are gone off the walls -- a kettle on a long ext lead is on the bare table behind.  They're all sitting th

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What do you think?  Good move?

dialogues.speaker: HONEY
dialogues.text: Good move: when all is said and done, she's nothing special.  I saw her taking her pants off and I definitely glimpsed some cellulite down there.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Good decision.  All actresses are mad as snakes.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Tony -- what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Never met her, never want to.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Brilliant.  Max?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  Never trust a vegetarian.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Great.  Excellent.  Thanks. Spike enters.

dialogues.speaker: SPIKE
dialogues.text: I was called and I came.  What's up?

dialogues.speaker: HONEY
dialogues.text: William has just turned down Anna Scott.

dialogues.speaker: SPIKE
dialogues.text: You daft prick! Bella is casually looking at the painting that sits besid William.  It is the original of the Chagall, the poster o was on his wall.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: This painting isn't the original, is it?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yes, I think that one may be.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: But she said she wanted to go out with you?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yes -- sort of...

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Well, you know, anybody saying they want to go out with you is... pretty great... isn't it...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: It was sort of sweet actually -- I mean, I know she's an actress and all that, so she can deliver a line -- but she said that she might be as famous as can be -- but also... that she was just a girl, standing in front of a boy, asking him to love her. They take in the line.  It totally reverses their attitud A pause.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Oh sod a dog.  I've made the wrong decision, haven't I? They look at him.  Spike does a big nod.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Max, how fast is your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's car arrives in the street outside.  They pile into car.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: If anyone gets in our way -- we have small nuclear devices.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: And we intend to use them!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Where's Bella?

dialogues.speaker: HONEY
dialogues.text: She's not coming.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Sod that.  Bernie -- in the back! He shoots out of his door, rushes round and grabs Bella o the chair.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Come on, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's car is shooting up Stanley Crescent.  We are inside outside the car.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Down Kensington Church Street, then Knightsbridge, then Hyde Park Corner.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Crazy.  Go along Bayswater...

dialogues.speaker: HONEY
dialogues.text: That's right -- then Park Lane.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Or you could go right down to Cromwell Road, and left.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No! Suddenly the car slams to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Stop right there!  I will decide the route.  All right?

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: James Bond never has to put up with this sort of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car turns illegally right across Piccadilly the wrong down a one-way street and ends up outside the Ritz.  Will sprints into the hotel.  Bernie follows.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Bloody hell, this is fun.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Is Miss Scott staying here? It is the same man.

dialogues.speaker: RITZ MAN
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: How about Miss Flintstone?

dialogues.speaker: RITZ MAN
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Or Bambi... or, I don't know, Beavis or Butthead? Man shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: RITZ MAN
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Right.  Right.  Fair enough.  Thanks. He turns despondent and takes two steps when the Ritz Man him in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: RITZ MAN
dialogues.text: There was a Miss Pocahontas in room 126 -- but she checked out an hour ago.  I believe she's holding a press conference at The Savoy before flying to America. William is very grateful.  He kisses the Ritz Man.  Berni gratuful.  He kisses him too.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: We have lift off!! A Japanese guest assumes this is the way to behave and th Man gets kissed a third time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car speeds through London.  It gets totally stuck at junction where no one will let them in.

dialogues.speaker: SPIKE
dialogues.text: Bugger this for a bunch of bananas. He gets out of the car and boldly stops the traffic comin opposite direction.  Our car shoots past him.

dialogues.speaker: SPIKE
dialogues.text: Go! They leave him behind.  Honey leans out the window and sh

dialogues.speaker: HONEY
dialogues.text: You're my hero. Spike waves wildly -- he loses concentration and is very hit by a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull to a stop.  William leaps out.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William rushes up to the main desk.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Excuse me, where's the press conference?

dialogues.speaker: MAN AT SAVOY
dialogues.text: Are you an accredited member of the press?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yes... He flashes a card.

dialogues.speaker: MAN AT SAVOY
dialogues.text: That's a Blockbuster video membership card, sir.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: That's right... I work for their in- house magazine. (mimes quotation marks) 'Movies are our business.'

dialogues.speaker: MAN AT SAVOY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir... Honey shoots into shot, pushing Bella's chair.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: He's with me.

dialogues.speaker: MAN AT SAVOY
dialogues.text: And you are?

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Writing an article about how London hotels treat people in wheelchairs.

dialogues.speaker: MAN AT SAVOY
dialogues.text: Of course, madam.  It's in the Lancaster Room.  I'm afraid you're very late.

dialogues.speaker: HONEY
dialogues.text: (to William) Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William runs, searching.  At last finds the room, and ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge room -- full of press.  Row after row of journalists cameras at the front, TV cameras at the back.  Anna clear gives press conferences very rarely, because this one is positively presidential.  She sits at a table at the end room, beside Karen: on her other side is Jeremy, the PR b firmly marshalling the questions.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: Yes... You -- Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: QUESTIONER 1
dialogues.text: How much longer are you staying in the UK then?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No time at all.  I fly out tonight. She's in a slightly melancholic and therefore honest mood

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: Which is why we have to round it up now. Final questions. He points at a journalist he knows.

dialogues.speaker: QUESTIONER 2
dialogues.text: Is your decision to take a year off anything to do with the rumours about Jeff and his present leading lady?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: QUESTIONER 2
dialogues.text: Do you believe the rumours?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: It's really not my business any more. Though I will say, from my experience, that rumours about Jeff... do tend to be true. They love that answer, and all scribble in their note boo Next question comes from someone straight right next to William.

dialogues.speaker: QUESTIONER 3
dialogues.text: Last time you were here, there were some fairly graphic photographs of you and a young English guy -- so what happened there?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: He was just a friend -- I think we're still friends.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: Yes, the gentleman in the pink shirt. He is pointing straight at William, who has his hand up.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yes -- Miss Scott -- are there any circumstances in which you two might be more than just friends? Anna sees who it is asking.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I hoped there might be -- but no, I'm assured there aren't.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: And what would you say...

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: No, it's just one question per person.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No, let him... ask away.  You were saying?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yes, I just wondered whether if it turned out that this... person...

dialogues.speaker: OTHER JOURNALIST
dialogues.text: (to William) His name is Thacker.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thanks.  I just wondered if Mr. Thacker realized he'd been a daft prick and got down on his knees and begged you to reconsider, whether you would... reconsider. We cut to Max, Bella, Bernie and Honey, all watching.  Th to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm pretty sure I would.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: That's very good news.  The readers of 'Horse and Hound' will be absolutely delighted. Anna whispers something to Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMY
dialogues.text: Dominic -- if you'd like to ask your question again?

dialogues.speaker: QUESTIONER 1
dialogues.text: Yes -- Anna -- how long are you intending to stay here in Britain? Pause.  Anna looks up at William.  He nods.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Indefinitely. They both smile -- suddenly the press gets what's going o music -- noise -- they all turn and flash, flash, flash p of William.  Max and Bella kiss.  Bernie kisses a total s Spike finally makes it -- he's bright red from running.

dialogues.speaker: SPIKE
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: HONEY
dialogues.text: It was good. Honey hugs him.  It's a new experience for Spike. Cut to William's face -- flash after flash -- still looki Anna.  They are both smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna and William at their wedding -- they kiss and walk i crowd. Honey, a bridesmaid in peach satin -- she is surrounded b least four other bridesmaids, all under five. Nearby, Tony standing, glowing, beside his fabulous, pyramidical wedding cake. William's mother is not quite happy with how he's looking tries to brush his hair. Max, dressed in the most devastating Bond-like white tuxe dancing with Anna -- thrilled.  He does a rather flashy l move.  Cut to Bella who is watching and laughing. Martin, in an awkward tweed suit, is jiggling to the beat song, entirely happy in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge premier -- screaming crowds -- Anna and William ge of the car, she holding his hand --  looking ultimately g -- he in a black tie that doesn't quite fit.  He's startl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pretty green communal garden.  Children are playing, wa by mothers, one of whom holds a new baby in a papoose.  A old couple wander along slowly. A small tai chi group moves mysteriously.  And as the cam glides, it passes a couple sitting on a single, simple wo bench overlooking the garden.  He is reading, she is just looking out, totally relaxed, holding his hand, pregnant. is William and Anna.
